alert.note: Alert for Bonner (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 10 at 8:11PM MDT until July 10 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Bonner County in the Panhandle of Idaho... Northeastern Spokane County in northeastern Washington... Southeastern Pend Oreille County in northeastern Washington... * Until 800 PM PDT. * At 710 PM PDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles south of Newport, or 11 miles southwest of Priest River, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Priest River, Newport, Dover, Oldtown, Cocolalla, and Blanchard. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 458 and 468. U.S. Highway 2 in Idaho between mile markers 1 and 25. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
